intro: Craterianthus, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a genus of flowering plants native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Craterianthus species often have a compact growth habit with clustered flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red. These plants are popular in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to their ornamental value and low water requirements.
